sentence.text: In this study, we reported the identification of Calcium Binding Protein 39-Like (signal transduction by protein phosphorylation) as a novel regulator of tumor metabolism in GC.

Functional studies suggested that signal transduction by protein phosphorylation functions as a tumor suppressor, as overexpression of signal transduction by protein phosphorylation elicited suppression of multiple cancer phenotypes both in GC cells and an orthotopic mouse model; whilst its knockdown promoted tumorigenesis.

protein phosphorylation-lipid biosynthetic process activation in GC cell lines was tumor suppressive, as metformin (an AMPK activator) inhibited GC cell growth in the signal transduction by protein phosphorylation-silenced cells.

Moreover, knockdown of protein phosphorylation reversed growth inhibitory effect of signal transduction by protein phosphorylation, indicating that tumor suppression by CAB39L depended on LKB1-lipid biosynthetic process.

Our data demonstrate that signal transduction by protein phosphorylation is a novel tumor suppressor which suppresses tumorigenesis by promoting protein phosphorylation-lipid biosynthetic process-PGC1Î± axis, thereby preventing a metabolic shift that drives carcinogenesis.
